required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Egg Consumption and Its Enrichment With Annatto on Cardiovascular Risk and Satiety in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effects of Egg Consumption and Its Enrichment With Annatto on Biomarkers of Cardiovascular Risk and Satiety in Adults.

collaborator.agency: Instituto Colombiano para el Desarrollo de la Ciencia y la Tecnología (COLCIENCIAS)

brief_summary.textblock:
Healthy adult volunteers (n= 105; 18-59 years) were randomly allocated to consume daily for 8 weeks, either two whole eggs (egg group), two whole eggs added with annatto (annatto-enriched egg group), or two egg whites (control). Volunteers were asked to continue with the habitual physical activity and diet, except for the consumption of additional eggs, egg whites or annatto.
It is hypothesized that participants consuming eggs would have a less atherogenic lipid profile, feel more satisfied and increase antioxidant levels in blood, compared to the control group. Participants in the annatto-enriched egg group would have greater antioxidant capacity than the egg group and compared to control.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Total cholesterol at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood total cholesterol in mg/dL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline LDL cholesterol at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood LDL cholesterol in mg/dL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline VLDL cholesterol at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood VLDL cholesterol in mg/dL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Triglycerides at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood triglycerides in mg/dL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline HDL cholesterol at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood HLDL cholesterol in mg/dL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Glucose at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood glucose in mg/dL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Systolic Blood Pressure at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure in mmHg will be used to present the results of this variable, as follow: e.g. 130 mmHg

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Diastolic Blood Pressure at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure in mmHg will be used to present the results of this variable, as follow: e.g. 85 mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index (BMI) in kg/m^2: weight in kilograms, height in meters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline BMI at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Waist circumference at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Waist circumference in centimeters measured at the superior border of the iliac crest

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Blood lutein levels at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood lutein levels in micrograms per mL

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Dietary lutein+zeaxanthin levels at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Dietary lutein+zeaxanthin levels in micrograms

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Blood bixin levels at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood bixin levels in %

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline TRLP size at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood subclasses (Large, medium, small) of TRLP in nmol/L measured by Nuclear Magnetic Resonance

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline LDL size at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood subclasses (Large, medium, small) of LDL in nmol/L measured by Nuclear Magnetic Resonance

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline HDL size at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood subclasses (Large, medium, small) of HDL in μmol/L measured by Nuclear Magnetic Resonance

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline ApoB at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood ApoB in mg/L measured by Nuclear Magnetic Resonance

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline ApoA1 at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting blood ApoA1 in mg/L measured by Nuclear Magnetic Resonance

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Ghrelin at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Ghrelin in pg/mL

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to Measure Perceived Hunger and Satiety
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline VAS of Hunger and Satiety at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: "Visual Analog Scale to measure perceived hunger and satiety" to complete in the morning, fasting, 5 days before entering the study and the last 5 days to end the study (8th week). The VAS consist of 8 questions followed each by a line of 10cm in which the person marks a position corresponding to his/her feelings about hunger and satiety. A higher score (10) means the person feels with more hunger or satisfied.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of genetic ethnicity of European, Amerindian and African for each participant

arm_group.description: Two whole eggs (50g each) to be eaten daily during 8 weeks
Two whole eggs (50g each) enriched with annatto (Bixa orellana L.) to be eaten daily during 8 weeks. Dose of annatto: 1,2 mg bixin/kg of body weight.
Two egg whites to be eaten daily during 8 weeks

intervention.description: Daily consumption of two whole eggs during 8 weeks
Daily consumption of two whole eggs enriched with annatto during 8 weeks
Daily consumption of two eggs whites during 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 18-59 years
- Body Mass Index (BMI): 18,5 - 29,9 kg/m2
- Healthy volunteers
- Good disposition to consume either eggs, egg whites or eggs added with annatto
- To have signed the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fasting blood triglycerides > 500mg/dL, Total Cholesterol > 240mg/dL, glucose > 126mg/dL or diabetes.
- Blood pressure: >140/90 mmHg.
- History or having any of the following: liver, kidney, or heart disease, cancer, endocrine or gastrointestinal disorders -especially those that limit food absorption.
- Use of medications to lower blood lipids or glucose.
- Consumption of multivitamins or nutraceuticals.
- Plan to lose body weight, pregnancy or breastfeeding.
- Any known allergy or intolerance to eggs or annatto.

facility.name: Sede de Investigación Universitaria - Universidad de Antioquia
